cheatsheet.title: Importing logical tables from SAP using Rapid Modeler for SAP

intro.description:
This cheat sheet shows you how to create a logical data model and how to import metadata for an SAP logical table.
NOTE: Be sure to enter the names of projects, models, etc. in the following steps exactly as indicated otherwise the "Click to perform" buttons might not work. However, the "Click when complete" buttons will continue to work.

item.title: Open the Data perspective
item.description: If you're not already in the Data perspective, in the main menu select Window > Open Perspective > Data.

item.title: Create a Data Design project
item.description:
Before creating a data model, we need a project to put it in. In the main toolbar, click on File > New > Data Design Project.
Enter RMTestProject in the Project name field.
Click Finish.

item.title: Create a logical data model file
item.description:
The next step is to create a new logical data model file. In the main toolbar again, click on File > New > Logical Data Model.
Make sure that the Destination folder is set to the name of the project created in the previous step, i.e., RMTestProject
Enter RMTableModel as the file name.
Click Finish.

item.title: Open the Rapid Modeler for SAP wizard on the logical model
item.description:
Now that you have created your logical model you are ready to import SAP metadata into this model.
In the Data Project Explorer view (typically on the upper left of the Data perspective) browse to the logical data model you have created in the previous step (RMTestProject > Data Models > RMTableModel.ldm).
Right-click on RMTableModel.ldm and select Rapid Modeler for SAP > Import SAP metadata.

item.title: Select SAP system
item.description:
On the first wizard page select an SAP system connection or use Edit to create one. Select the Browse SAP for tables option.
Click Next.

item.title: Search for tables
item.description: On the Browse SAP for tables page enter the query KN*1 in the text field and click Search.

item.title: Select tables
item.description:
In the table on the left hand side (Tables found) select a table, e.g., KNA1. Click on Add tables. The table should move to the right hand side (Selected tables).
Click Next.

item.title: Configure Import options
item.description:
On the Table Import options page uncheck Import metadata for related check tables.
Click Next.

item.title: Review tables
item.description:
On the Review tables to be imported page, review the tables to be imported.
Click Next.

item.title: Skip technical fields
item.description:
On the Technical fields page, uncheck Configure additional technical fields.
Click Next.

item.title: Skip non-default package
item.description:
On the Select package for import page, uncheck Use a specific package as an import destination.
Â´When you click Next the import process will start.
Click Next.

item.title: Finish the wizard
item.description:
On the Import Summary page, review the import summary.
Click Finish to save the imported model to your logical data model.
item.onCompletion: Congratulations! You have imported a logical table from SAP into your logical data model.
